_comment: Post-extraction overrides for generated OpenAPI specs. Each key is scope/service (e.g. workspace/database). Each override specifies a json_path (dot-delimited, with array index support) and the value to set at that path.

workspace/database.description: Make uid parameter required for findByUid

workspace/ml.description: Make filter parameter required for search registered models

workspace/settings.description: Override workspace-conf GET 200 response schema with explicit config properties

customReferences.description: Custom reference links displayed in the workspace help menu

enable-X-Frame-Options.description: Controls the X-Frame-Options HTTP header to prevent clickjacking by restricting iframe embedding

enableClusterAclsConfig.description: Enables cluster-level access control lists (ACLs) for managing cluster permissions

enableDatabricksAutologgingAdminConf.description: Enables or disables Databricks Autologging for MLflow experiments at the workspace level

enableDcs.description: Enables Delta Cache Service for accelerated data reads from cloud storage

enableDbfsFileBrowser.description: Enables the DBFS visual file browser in the workspace UI

enableDeprecatedGlobalInitScripts.description: Enables legacy global init scripts (deprecated in favor of the Global Init Scripts API)

enableEnforceImdsV2.description: Enforces IMDSv2 (Instance Metadata Service v2) on cluster nodes for improved security (AWS only)

enableExportNotebook.description: Controls whether users can export notebooks from the workspace

enableFileStoreEndpoint.description: Enables the /FileStore endpoint for accessing files uploaded to DBFS FileStore

enableGp3.description: Enables GP3 EBS volumes for cluster nodes instead of GP2 (AWS only)

enableHlsRuntime.description: Enables the Databricks Runtime for Health and Life Sciences (genomics and biomedical workloads)

enableIpAccessLists.description: Enables IP access list functionality to restrict workspace access by IP address (Premium tier required)

enableJobAclsConfig.description: Enables job-level access control lists (ACLs) for managing job permissions

enableJobViewAcls.description: Enables view-level ACLs on jobs, restricting visibility of jobs to permitted users

enableJobsEmailsV2.description: Enables the updated email notification system for job run results

enableNotebookTableClipboard.description: Controls whether users can copy table data from notebook output to the clipboard

enableProjectTypeInWorkspace.description: Enables project-type resources within the workspace

enableProjectsAllowList.description: Enables the projects allow list to restrict which Git repositories can be used

enableResultsDownloading.description: Controls whether users can download query and notebook results

enableTokensConfig.description: Enables or disables personal access token creation and management for the workspace

enableUploadDataUis.description: Enables the data upload UI for importing files into the workspace

enableVerboseAuditLogs.description: Enables verbose audit logging with additional event details including notebook command results

enableWebTerminal.description: Enables web-based terminal access to cluster driver nodes from the workspace UI

enableWorkspaceAclsConfig.description: Enables workspace-level access control lists (ACLs) for managing workspace object permissions

enableWorkspaceFilesystem.description: Enables the workspace filesystem for storing and accessing workspace files

enforceClusterViewAcls.description: Enforces view-level ACLs on clusters, restricting cluster visibility to permitted users

enforceUserIsolation.description: Enforces user isolation on clusters to prevent users from accessing each others data

enforceWorkspaceViewAcls.description: Enforces view-level ACLs on workspace objects, restricting visibility to permitted users

heapAnalyticsAdminConsent.description: Controls admin consent for Heap Analytics usage tracking in the workspace

homePageLogo.description: Custom logo image URL displayed on the workspace home page

homePageLogoWidth.description: Width in pixels of the custom home page logo

homePageWelcomeMessage.description: Custom welcome message displayed on the workspace home page

jobsListBackendPaginationEnabled.description: Enables backend pagination for the jobs list API for improved performance with large job counts

jobsListBackendPaginationOptOut.description: Opts out of backend pagination for the jobs list if enabled at the workspace level

loginLogo.description: Custom logo image URL displayed on the workspace login page

loginLogoWidth.description: Width in pixels of the custom login page logo

maxTokenLifetimeDays.description: Maximum lifetime in days for newly created personal access tokens (empty or 0 means no limit)

mlflowModelRegistryEmailNotificationsEna.description: Enables email notifications for MLflow Model Registry events such as model version transitions

mlflowModelServingEndpointCreationEnable.description: Enables creation of MLflow model serving endpoints in the workspace

mlflowRunArtifactDownloadEnabled.description: Controls whether users can download artifacts from MLflow experiment runs

productName.description: Custom product name displayed in the workspace UI (white-labeling)

projectsAllowList.description: Comma-separated list of allowed Git repository URL prefixes for workspace projects

projectsAllowListPermissions.description: Permissions configuration for who can manage the projects allow list

rStudioUserDefaultHomeBase.description: Default home directory base path for RStudio users in the workspace

reposIpynbResultsExportPermissions.description: Controls permissions for exporting ipynb notebook results from Git-backed repos

sidebarLogoActive.description: Custom logo image URL for the active state of the workspace sidebar

sidebarLogoInactive.description: Custom logo image URL for the inactive state of the workspace sidebar

sidebarLogoText.description: Custom text displayed alongside the sidebar logo (white-labeling)

storeInteractiveNotebookResultsInCustome.description: Stores all interactive notebook results in the customer cloud account instead of the Databricks control plane
